item.title: Simple question
item.dc:creator: @KeV KeV
item.description:
@KeV wrote:

PussyCrunch, has basicly summed this up. But…

>=

This basicly mean “More than or equal to”, meaning if its set to 3, you’ll need a mod level of 3+ to use it. Concluding that level 2 or below cant.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple question
item.dc:creator: @PussyCrunch PussyCrunch
item.description:
@PussyCrunch wrote:

Dude, this is simple. Where is says && playerRights >= 3) Just change the 3 to a 0 if you want all members to spawn, if you want all mods, staff, and administrators to spawn change the 3 to a 1. If you want only Staff and Administrators to spawn, change the 3 to a 2, and if you want only Administrators to spawn, keep it a 3.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple question
item.dc:creator: @Blood_Argon Blood_Argon
item.description:
@Blood_Argon wrote:

Well, I was getting confused with this playerrights setting…

else if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && playerRights >= 3)
{
try {

I want to set it so that levels 1, 2 AND 3 can spawn. (1-mod, 2-staff, 3-admin)
Call me a noob, whatever. But, I just would like to know.[br][size=1]Posted at: August 06, 2006, 12:14:06 PM[/size][hr]Also, I need to be able to mute users. I dont think the mod option under the report thing works.[br][size=1]Posted at: August 06, 2006, 12:17:00 PM[/size][hr]Bump
